hook.text: In 1788, Europeans brought rats to Australia. They've been devouring native wildlife ever since.

buildup.text: Invasive species arrive by ship, plane, or intentional introduction â€” then explode unchecked.

discovery.text: Without natural predators, invaders outcompete, eat, or infect native species into oblivion.

twist.text: Brown tree snakes in Guam wiped out 10 of 12 native forest bird species after World War II.

climax.text: Invasive species are the second biggest cause of extinction worldwide after habitat loss.

punchline.text: One stowaway can unravel an island's entire web of life.

quiz.question: What is the second biggest cause of species extinction?
